website_summaries.verdict: Our top pick for its versatility for removing pet hair – works for various lengths and can be used on cats and dogs of almost any size.
pros: Has many practical purposes that make it a top pick
Has the ability to remove loose hair up to 2 inches on mid-sized dogs
A good size option for most cats, too
FURejector button makes cleanup a breeze
cons: You may want to choose a larger size for bigger dogs
otherwise it is one of FURminator's most versatile models and a dependable grooming tool

customer_reviews.title: I'm amazed.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it's normal or not but my French bulldog and Chihuahua mutts both sheds alot! I always thought furminator was for long hair dogs but I saw a review for a bulldog so I figure I'll give it a try and I'm thoroughly amazed. This thing not only catches alot of hair it even gets his dandruff. Plus side is that they like to be brushed. Win-win for me, only wish I bought this earlier lol I do recommend using this outside so that you can just brush off the loose hair's off and not have to vacuum after you're done brushing.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: product was counterfeit (2013)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this. Seemed to work okay. Then got my hands on a real one. What a difference in grooming results & quality. So I chose to buy an authentic Furminator in a real pet store to replace the unit which is in the trash now. Order was from back in 2013. See the pics. Seller was 3rd party but fulfilled by amazon. Good Luck, there are many bootleg Furminators out there, and you may not know it is fake until after it is too late for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: woof bark woof

customer_reviews.title: The best grooming tool ever invented!
customer_reviews.text: I will never be without a Furminator ever again, it's an absolute must have in my grooming regimen. I have a 45lb Australian Shepherd and an 18lb Cavalier King Charles Spaniel whose long hair would be a nightmare to deal with without my trusty Furminator. I also recommend the Furminator brand mat removal tool. I use the Furminator every couple months and it really helps keep the fur-bunnies from appearing on the hardwood floors. The dogs seem so much more comfortable after getting furminated too. I included a picture of my Aussie after he was groomed with the Furminator and de-matting tool. Its also great for getting pesky dog hair off couches and throw blankets!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Pet Grooming Tool
customer_reviews.text: Our Vet recommended this and WOW are we ever glad we got one! Our 70-lb. Black & Tan Coonhound has a beautiful thick coat but he really suffers in the heat I think. I use this on him once a week and always after his bath (fur must be 100% DRY) and his coat has a varnish-looking lustrous gloss PLUS we're keeping a LOT of shedding hair out of the house. I highly recommend this to any pet owner - our Bubba looks great and appears to be more comfortable as well. I would go so far as to call this a "Must-Have" item and I don't say that often.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Foster

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS IF YOU HAVE A GSD!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 German Shepherds. I had a brush similar to this that I bought from the pet store. My coworker told me about this product so I decided to try it out. HOLY HAIR. I have never been able to remove SO MUCH HAIR from our dogs in the 3 years we have had them. Our dogs have always disliked being brushed but after using this a couple times they will actually lay down to get brushed. Their coats are so much shinier and healthier. It’s incredible. You need this in your life. Don’t hesitate on this brush. I’m still amazed after using it for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Really works, dogs think it’s a belly rub
customer_reviews.text: I love dogs, but I absolutely cannot stand dog hair on me, my car, anywhere!!! Drives me nuts. Being a current owner of two short haired dogs, my nightmare came true. My 2 year old American bulldog leaves so much hair on my clothes so I figured id give it a shot. This product really takes out hair I didn’t even know were there and doesnf make a mess as it cleans. My 2 month old Labrador is the same. So much hair it’s crazy. Doesn’t hurt them at all like some people commented. They actually think it’s belly rub time while they’re getting brushed. Works for me!
customer_reviews.author: Angie R.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this tool, as do my two german shepherds. I have many deshedding tools but I love this one because it gets straight to the undercoat. My girls enjoyed me just brushing their coat without it pulling their fur. I highly recommend getting at least the add on spray. It smells amazing and seemed to help remove the undercoat. One negative for me is the ejector button. You pay extra for it, but it doesn't really work. Personally I would've gotten a cheaper model if I had known this. Other then that, we love it! Unfortunately I don't have before and after photos, it definitely made a huge difference
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: For those who are on the fence
customer_reviews.text: This product is unbelievable. I have a German Shepherd mix. He sheds ALL the time and it goes EVERYWHERE. My vacuum is never put away because of the amount of shedding he does. If you aren’t sure if you should buy the FURminator watch my video as proof it works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow, just wow!
customer_reviews.text: So I have a pug. They've got a beautiful thick undercoat & shed like crazy. I couldn't emerge from snuggling without being covered in hair. Someone told me this was a scam, I beg to differ. First session I retrieved a dense 6 inch ball of hair (think skein of yarn). What I hadn't realized was the mechanism for disposing the hair. The push button release for the hair is genius. I bravely wore black today & I'm happy to report only a few flecks of hair were on me after spending the whole day with my fur baby! I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Wende V

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product. My dog loves being "brushed"
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. My dog loves being "brushed", and it does a great job of getting the undercoat hair before it falls off on my carpet. I gave it four starts because the ejector button that is supposed to release the hair has no effect at all. But, it's simple to just grab the hair off the blade. It's not sharp enough to cut skin...or it wouldn't be a good tool to scrape along my dog's body. Blade is probably not the correct term. But, it brings the loose hair off the dog and leaves a beautiful coat. This is a must-have tool for grooming my dog. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Florida Housewife

customer_reviews.title: Skip it and buy a Rake
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews made this seem like the MUST HAVE item for dog grooming. We bought it for our two golden retrievers and I am not happy with it. It seems to me, it mostly cut and pulled their hair without ever getting to the undercoat. The "teeth" are sharp even if it did get to their skin level. It was a constant clean out of the brush from hair. To spend all the time grooming them with the FURminator, I was still leaving the job half done. They have a thick undercoat I was never reaching. Very overpriced. We went back to using an undercoat rake. - Jen
customer_reviews.author: Ringo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for different sized dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this tool on each of my 4 dogs once, and already I love it! We have dogs ranging from short hair, to medium length and one that is a little over 2 inches. This tool works so well! A gentle hand is all it takes, and after just a few minutes, their coats are so much softer and I can tell the dogs feel better. I obsessed a little about which size to get since we have different sized dogs, and the medium sized, short hair tool works great for us. Make sure you have a basket, trash can, bag, or something to put the hair in. On a windy day, that fur can travel far!
customer_reviews.author: It's Me

customer_reviews.title: I don’t see a difference.
customer_reviews.text: I bought an off brand cheap deshedding brush before I bought this, and that thing would collect a bunch of loose hair off my pug. I thought “why not try the brand name one” so I bought this on the deal of the day, and it’s harder to brush the pug AND it doesn’t seem to collect as much fur so I’m stuck going at it for a looooong time. It actually seems to just loosen the fur rather than actually collect it, so then my pug shakes and hair goes flying everywhere. I’d go for the cheap brand that has the bristles like a human hair brush.
customer_reviews.author: TSOBK

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is no better than a standard five dollar brush you can get anywhere. It does not work any better than anything else despite the claims by the manufacturer or the reviews here. I assume many of the reviews are were "incentivized" in order to get this high of a rating. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my Rotties!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely luv this product! My Rottie's were shedding a whole lot. I had to vacuum my wood floors 1-2 times a day to keep up with their flying fur. After using the Furminator & deshedding spray, all of us live much happier! Seriously works amazingly. The Furminator & deshedding spray together cut the shedding down by 90%. First week I bagged enough of their hair that it looked like a triplet joined us. It gets the hair deep underneath, stuff other brushes leave in. To get the full benefit of both product, use them together. You'll see a huge difference in the 1st day. I used them daily for 1st week, now I use them once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Stormy

customer_reviews.title: Size & Length Matters!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a game changer. It really does help with the shedding! I have a corgi and the "Medium Size for Short Hair" worked great up until she turned 6 months. Then it wasn't long enough to get through her undercoat anymore, so I had to order the next size up, "Medium Size for Long Hair" and it works perfectly now! Make sure to always choose the correct size for your pup, even if it means you have to buy multiple ones as they're growing. You don't want to risk ripping out your dog's fur!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer V

customer_reviews.title: Can you make a dog hairless? Not with a Lab
customer_reviews.text: So we just had to have a puppy. And we fell in love with Polly, a yellow lab. I didn't research the breed much and certainly didn't think fur would be an issue - but it was! And you can't give Polly back when your heart strings have become attached. So Furminator it is! All I can share is - be careful and read the directions. You do not want to create any skin issues so this is not an every day use item. I would recommend maybe one a week and gently glide it over the fur. It works. I have cut down her furriest times and it has helped. Easy to use. RECOMMEND: Read the Directions.
customer_reviews.author: Fyredown

customer_reviews.title: Best brush so far
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best brush I've used so far. The ONLY reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because it's a little too harsh for the areas that are sparse or thin with hair. It's excellent for the neck and rump areas, but it pulled a little too much on his sides and on his flanks. Overall he loves being brushed and would fall asleep until I got to those more sensitive areas. Once I got the hang of it and was sure to use a softer touch he didn't even notice. It really does leave your animal's coat super soft and shiny and gets a good amount of fur and loose dander.
customer_reviews.author: Midnight*sun

customer_reviews.title: Save your money short hair dog owners
customer_reviews.text: I have a Labrador Retriever , he sheds all the time , a lot! I thought after reading the reviews this tool would work wonders, I’m disappointed. I’ve used it 3 times so far and I don’t think it works any better on him than the regular dog brush I bought at the grocery store. However, it is easier to clean and it must feel good because my dog loves it when I brush him with it. For the price, I wouldn’t recommend to owners of short haired dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Save your money...
customer_reviews.text: Works better than just a plain old pet brush, but it removed only about 1/3 of loose hair from my dog (his hair is pretty short). Also, the hair release feature: it doesn’t hold much hair before you have to release by pushing a button on the back which is a pain because the hair gets stuck in the brush and you have to pull the hair out by hand. Was super excited for this product. Eh.
customer_reviews.author: C P

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and time
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and thought I hit the jackpot, I bought this even though it’s not considered cheap! I usualaly use the glove brush and lately my puppy Pitt is shedding a lot all over the clotrhjng and furniture. This did not even remove 0.01% of my dogs lose hair, I finished and started with the glove that I try avoiding because is painful to my arm! and it was ridiculous how much hair I got after deshedding him! If I am using it right, it’s Not worth it! Waste of money and time! go get a 7$ glove brush and will do a lot better job!
customer_reviews.author: Carole Zeineddine

customer_reviews.title: The medium size works fine, especially around his legs and stuff
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but this FURminator really does work wonders at removing the loose undercoat. I bought the short hair version in the medium size for my 60 lb chocolate lab. The medium size works fine, especially around his legs and stuff, but I would probably step up to the 'large' size if I had to do it over again, just to make quicker work of brushing his sides and back.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K.Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Most Efficient Tool I've Ever Owned!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is absolutely the best and most efficient tool for dog hair removal I've ever seen. My husband was complaining about my Sheltie shedding hair all over (she sheds in July) and our daughter told me about this item. I LOVE it and don't know why I'd never heard of it before. In two days and two times using it, her hair was all out. I highly recommend. When I told my friend about it she said she had one but needed to do Jake's fur pretty bad. The very next day she send me pics of all the hair she got off of his coat! Guilt trip. lol
customer_reviews.author: GiGiBlogger

customer_reviews.title: I would absolutely order this again
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been really frustrated with the hair tumbleweeds blowing around my house. No matter how much I vacuum, they just are always there. Saw this in a sponsored ad and ordered it on a whim. It arrived today today and OMG!! I don’t know what kind of sorcery this is, but holy crap! I have a 55 lb long haired black lab and got an entire plastic bag of hair off of her! With each pass I had to clean the brush because it was a straight line of pure hair. When I got done, there was a visible difference in her coat’s shine and the brown in her coat started showing through. I would absolutely order this again.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: It's made well and easy to hold!
customer_reviews.text: The brush itself seemed well made and was easy to hold. It did not work for my small short haired dog. She is a chihuahua/Manchester Terrier mix. Her fur lays flat against her body. It pulled some fur out, but not anywhere close to the amount that the pictures or videos show. It also seemed to rip it out, made her yelp. In the pictures/videos and instructions show that the fur collects in the teeth and you use the button to release and empty it. Her fur would not collect within the teeth, it just laid on her body or fell all over everything. Seller has been great at communicating and returning was effortless. Just waiting on refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: This does a phenomenal job!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this large FURminator for short haired dogs because I had owned one previously for my long-haired Dachshunds and it was so helpful in thinning their thick undercoats. It took forever for me to receive this one, but when I got it yesterday, I immediately used it on my Labrador. It worked beautifully. I got tons of hair/undercoat off of her. She was unsure about it at first, but after being careful to use it gently, she opened up to the idea of it. She seems a lot more comfortable now.
customer_reviews.author: A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase I Made This Year
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been waffling on buying this for a few years. Honestly, my dog hates being brushed, and this doesn’t make it easier, but every swipe is MUCH more valuable in terms of reducing the shedding. Also, ngl, I use it on myself too... It’s a lot more effective than my hairbrush, even though it kind of hurts, but it took my hair from poofy triangle hair disaster to an actually attractive level of volume. Still not sure how to feel about the fact I use my dog’s brush on me more than her but #itsfine
customer_reviews.author: suew

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: We have a long-haired dog who sheds constantly. Using this on her a few times per week for 10 minutes has made a significant difference in the amount she sheds. She does not seem to mind us using this on her (although we tried it on our smaller, shorter-haired dog who sheds a little bit and it seemed to irritate him) and she sits patiently while we use it. I would recommend this product to anyone who has a dog that sheds and who is trying to control the shedding.
customer_reviews.author: Anny

customer_reviews.title: So. Much. Fur.
customer_reviews.text: Yasssssssssss!!!! I have a Saint Pyrenees (st Bernard, Great Pyrenees, yeti, small horse mix) and I thought she may be sick when I adopted her because of the clumps of fur I find all over my house. Turns out these dogs just shed a lot. This thing seems to really get a ton of hair off of her so I’m hopeful it cuts down on the daily vacuuming. She also seems to love getting brushed with it and just stands there as mounds of fur pool around her body. She may still end up shedding all over but it’s still super rewarding to see all of this fur coming off of her when I use this dude.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps with Shedding Messes
customer_reviews.text: I have a Basset Hound. His fur is short, but it sheds...a lot... all year long! A friend recommended that I try brushing him with Furminator a few times per week to see if it helps: it really does help eliminate some of the pet hair in the house. The tiny teeth on the brush collect all the loose hair. A button on the top of the brush head releases the collected hair. I'll brush my basset for just a couple minutes (with a waste basket at my side) about twice per week. My basset and I have developed a routine, and I'm happy to say the house has a lot less pet hair messes in between vacuuming.
customer_reviews.author: S. H. Wells

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe the price difference!
customer_reviews.text: These are upwards of $70 at PetSmart! When I saw them on here for so much less, I was convinced they had to be knock offs. But they are the real deal guys! I am a professional groomer and swear by furminators! Once I realized these were real furminators, I purchased every single size available! You can't pass up this deal. The price is unavailable! One tip though, protect your furminators! The blades will chip and break if you don't store them properly.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Holmes

customer_reviews.title: In a class by its own
customer_reviews.text: well earlier today I comb my dog with a oster shed tool that I have had for I guess a year. I order this tool because of reviews and my neighboor has three dogs and uses the fermenator. I do not know why anyone could give less then five stars on this. I suspect if they dont they work for competitor or they do not use correctly. This is the best product on market that I have used and I recomend anyone to buy this. You wont be sending back! Excellent product period!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kokito

customer_reviews.title: A must have for Pet owners, Best one out there!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best deShedding tool I have ever bought. It's made well, it doesn't come apart while you are grooming you pet and it's truly self cleaning with a push of a button. I use it on my dogs and even though it's for short haired dogs I used it on my cat and she loves it the most! I can't believe how much fur I can remove and honestly much easier doing this then removing it from my clothes or furniture. They love it , It's is easy and I enjoy spending time with each on of my pets.
customer_reviews.author: An Artists with a purpose

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: With our Lab and Lab/Corgi mix, their undercoats are such a mess. Clean the house and 5 minutes later you find hair tumbleweeds. With this brush, they shed a lot less. A LOT! Both of them enjoy this brush more than any other brush we've used on them. What's really funny is that we bought it for the dogs, and one of cats came over to also get brushed. Even as a short/medium hair cat, this worked on him. He liked it and it cleaned his coat right up. So dogs and cats, the undercoat is cleaned up and their coats are silky smooth and shiny without the shed mess all over the house anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Fur fighter
customer_reviews.text: This was the greatest investment in our Norfolk Terrier puppy's grooming routine ever! Our little guy is brushed daily; however, twice a week we use the Furminator, and he loves it. During the initial week to ten days a lot of his undercoat was removed, which we expected. As we continue to use it on a regular, twice a week, schedule less and less hair is being removed. It has greatly reduced the number of "fur fiends" (dust/hair bunnies) floating around and hiding under the furniture. I don't ever want to be without a Furminator as long as I have dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Haly

customer_reviews.title: The Slicker Pro wins hands down
customer_reviews.text: The Furminator does an good job of picking up shedding dog hair. The quick release doesn't work well for me and I have to pick the hair clumps off by hand. Compared to the "Self-Cleaning Slicker Pro" by The Pet Portal it is only adequate. The Slicker Pro with the retractable tines releases all the hair with one push of the button. I have used both for several months and have found The Slicker Pro to be a superior product. I have a german shepard/siberian huskey mix who is constantly in a shedding mode, so I have extensively used both products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow - I'm Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this yesterday and I'm in disbelief. Have a Great Pyr. mix whose fur is always a mess, even after brushing, not to mention the fur bunnies everywhere. I have an undercoat brush but it just doesn't seem to take care of the matted fur even with daily brushing. With just one use, I got enough fur to construct a whole other dog! He looks fantastic and I can tell he feels much better too. And the best part - I didn't have any fur bunnies to vacuum up this morning. This was after just one quick brushing. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: brueggie

customer_reviews.title: Returned because of P65 cancer warning.
customer_reviews.text: The brush might be a good one but I returned it due to the fact that a warning came stuck to the package that it contains styrene, a known carcinogen. If this was something I hardly planned on touching, I’d keep it but since I brush my dog often, I opted to return. I looked at the report online and it said that both lung, reproductive, and other cancers result from higher levels of exposure. I didn’t want to mess with it. I’ll find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Fisherman

customer_reviews.title: I did not like this Furminator - it's different from the old ones ...
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this Furminator - it's different from the old ones - not as good. Would not recommend it. I definitely recommend the original Furminator - I've owned several and they're awesome. This one is not.
customer_reviews.author: LittleGreenWingsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This works so much better than the 1st Gen Furminator I bought years ago. The "eject hair" button is a real timesaver. The handle is very comfortable and the length of teeth works very well as you would hope, if you bought one for a dog with longer hair. The width is perfect for accessing smaller areas rather than just their back and sides. The price is unbeatable. If you've priced these in stores, you know what I mean. $50 cheaper for the exact same product! I have three Aussies and the amount of hair "snow banks" I'm finding in the house is significantly reduced if used regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Angie M

customer_reviews.title: Great for huskies!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I have a husky and tried several other shedding tools before buying a furminator and wished I hadn’t. This is amazing and way better then the other grooming tools I tried. Plus, my dog loves when I use it on her and she is aurally picky about being groomed.
customer_reviews.author: Mary McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: My dog says "worth evey penny, don't stop"
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was rather expensive but I'm desperate to at least slow down all the hair everywhere. I'm impressed not only with how well it works but with my dogs reaction to it. After a few minutes she layed down and sighed like she had died and gone to heaven. Unbelievable Follow up- (two days later) she's actually hardly shedding. So it works.😲
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: SUPER EFFECTIVE! (American Eskimo)
customer_reviews.text: I literally just got this product about half an hour ago and I raced to try it out because of all the reviews and I can only say one thing... ITS SO COOL AND IT WORKS!! I have an American Eskimo and if you have one you know that they are SUPER hairy and they shed like crazy 24/7 which isn’t that great considering my wardrobe is mostly dark colors. BUT this device is amazing and I’m hoping it reduces the amount of shedding my pup does. I’m very grateful for the company and person who invented this!
customer_reviews.author: Cristyn

customer_reviews.title: Go Gently. My dog wagged her tail. Loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I had to write a review for this product. WOW. I have a medium length chocolate Chihuahua. She actually wagged her tail when I used this tool on her. It gets down to her skin. I saw dead skin cells and undercoat come off and she is SO SOFT now. I was told by a friend not to use it too much, but if a product expert from Furminator would please clarify as to use...I would appreciate feedback on recommended use. Product comes with zero instructions, but it's a bladed comb. Go gently. My dog loves it and I have seen diminished flying hair in the house. Solid tool.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Like the other reviews
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why I've had dogs for 20+ years and never owned one of these. We've had ours for about 2 weeks now and with consistent use it helps so much! Like the other reviews, the first time we used it on both of our dogs we got SO MUCH hair off of them, it was amazing. And, they loved it! They wanted more! LOL We still have some shedding but it's much less than it was before. We have a medium hair & short hair dog. Highly recommend to reduce the shedding in your home! It's easy to use, fits comfortably in our hand and does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best investments I've made
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a GODSEND. One of the best investments I've made, and my Jack Russell practically passes out from pure relaxation when we use it. I've never seen so many little curly white caterpillar hair bunches come off of one dog's bum, especially a small dog, but my god they were ankle deep. If you're on the fence about whether to buy this, buy it. If you're on the fence as to whether your dog realllllllllllllllllllllllllllly needs this, s/he does. Trust me. It still requires actually brushing your dog; this won't come with a robot butler to pay attention to your pet for you, but it makes the job of deshedding enjoyable for you both.
customer_reviews.author: marie.

customer_reviews.title: The holy grail of grooming products
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how many different deshedding tools I have purchased at this point - all claiming to be the best and had lots of great reviews. None of them worked that great though. This thing, however, is amazing. We don’t even have long-haired dogs. Just two yellow labs that go through some intense shedding seasons twice a year. We filled up an entire grocery bag full of their hair after using this on them. My husband and I were in disbelief after the dead, loose hair just kept coming out. Also, the dogs were in complete bliss as they each got their brush down. Normally we have a hard time getting to cooperate during brushing.
customer_reviews.author: kcm

customer_reviews.title: Can’t recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. My chow who has a double coat and he hasn’t reached his seasonal sheadding yet is stil shedding where I have to vacuum daily. Brushing alone is good but this pull out dead hairs and trim the rest a little. Took me about 30-45 minutes but I brushed his whole body including headband around feet. He enjoyed it so much that he was snorting while I was brushing him. I would recommend this to anyone who wants less shedding and a nice clean fluffy fur. Fur should be dry and brushed a little to derange to prevent pulling. The hair pictures is only from one side.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Summer life saver
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this brush. I have an Australian cattle dog, who sheds like crazy. We live in south Florida, so it is particularly worse during the summer months.
